Residual Current Circuit Breakers, for detecting and interrupting leakage current to
 ground. By detecting small leakage currents and disconnecting all ungrounded
connectors quickly, RCDs can prevent injury to exposed personnel and damage to
1492-RCD Residual Current Devices
equipment.

This is a short overview of I0-Link technology. For more details please refer to I0-Link specification published on IO-Link community web
page https://io-link.com.
 The I0-Link technology is an open point-to-point communication standard and was launched as (IS) IEC 61131-9. 10-Link is now the globally
standardized technology developed initially mainly for sensor and actuator communication with a field bus system. This technology provides
I0-Link provides a point-to-point link between the I/0 module and device that is used for transferring detailed diagnostics, device identity
 information, process data, and parameterization.
I0-Link communication is based on a structure in which the master controls the interface access to the I0-Link device. The option of using
the intelligence that is integrated into the IO-Link device provides the user with new commissioning methods. Benefits range from reduced
installation time during startup to increased diagnostics over the lifetime of the machine.

applications include, but are not limited to, the protection of test
equipment, control instrumentation, solenoids, and power supplies.
The wide range of current values and the use of a thermal magnetic
trip system allows for a variety of applications where a very
accurate and compact breaker is required.
